reviewDescription: I own almost everything Apple, will swear by their products, but the 3rd gen AirPods physical design is awful. They sound great across the frequency spectrum, especially the bass. But they are enormous compared to the 2nd gen AirPods. They’re constantly coming out of position and falling out. These complaints have been so frequent that Apple even released a “tutorial” on how to make them fit better by rotating them towards your face while they’re in but it doesn’t really work. Any movement such as even just chewing will make them pivot out of position. It’s just disappointing considering how convenient and ergonomic previous AirPods have been.

reviewTitle: You better have big ears to wear these!
reviewDescription: I've had "regular" AirPods for years and never had a problem (until they died).  I was so excited for these new AirPods but I swear they are so big that they won't stay in my ears.  They literally JUMP out of my ears - like multiple times during a zoom call! And I keep pushing them into my ears hoping they'll stay and now my ears feel bruised.  Definitely think twice before paying this kind of money for a product that you may or may not be able to use.  I wish I had worn them more during the return window because now I'm stuck.

reviewTitle: Nothing will make these stay in-ear
reviewDescription: My return window closed two days ago. That's after waiting over two weeks for the earbuds to be shipped, and then deciding to give them one more try by buying an accessory that would help them not fall out. That accessory arrived today so I'm screwed, as they say. I had the first generation airpods and at least those would stay in the ear. You couldn't run or do heavy workouts but they would stay in. But the microphone and battery life deteriorated (aka planned obsolescence-d) so I needed new ones for calls and such. I tried wearing the new ones around the house, walking the dog, or just sitting down and taking a call - I have to keep them in my ear with my hands if I don't want to lose them. I tried the over-the-ear plastic thing (another $10 wasted), but the fit is still so loose that they eventually fall out. Also, if you want to hear anything with these, they have to be right up against your ear canal, otherwise the sound dissipates and the volume is too low to hear - enjoy holding them both pressed up to your ear if you want to use them. I'm so disappointed... I'm an Apple fan and would pick their products before any others but lately they've had a lot of fails. I wish I could return these...

Complete garbage. They didn't even last me 5 months. I obliterated the left bud because it would CONSTANTLY disconnect. And I mean CONSTANTLY. Imagine trying to workout and only hear your music through one ear bud EVERY FEW SECONDS and having to constantly reset it??? No thanks. Never again. Over-priced, over-rated and irritating.

The sound was not at all what I was expecting for the price. I am so underwhelmed and disappointed! I liked the earbuds that came with my iPhone 11 Pro Max better, but they don't work with my new iPhone 15 Pro. Also, they are constantly falling out of my ears. I have ordered Yurbuds, and if the sizing isn't right, it's going to be an absolute nightmare finding a solution. I have been a loyal Apple customer for years and I just can't believe they would put their name on a shoddy product like this.

I’ve had these for 4/5 months and they started cutting out and disconnecting every few minutes. I have to manually reconnect them to Bluetooth. I have the newest iPhone available, everything is updated. I keep the AirPods in a case and charge them as needed. It’s getting really annoying, considering these are expensive.

reviewTitle: Not very good quality.  Fall out easy.
reviewDescription: The quality wasn't very good.  Noise cancelling not great and they fall out very easily.  Returned them to Amazon and the Amazon customer service was very poor.  BEWARE - the return process was difficult and Amazon wouldn't credit back my $$ for 14 days - even though I was charged immediately when I bought the product.  Showed on line that they had my return, but, Amazon waited before crediting my account.  I'm sure that's their policy to hold on to client's $$ for as long as possible, but, it's lame.

I have bought multiple $99 AirPods for myself and kids. Decided to splurge an extra 50 bucks for myself. Ouch!!! Definitely too thick. I had to switch my child for the cheaper ones and give them the “pricier/better” AirPods, per the price and description.

reviewTitle: They do not stay in my ear
reviewDescription: Sound is great,  but the pods do not stay in my ears. They slip all the time or fall out completely. I’ve even lost one at a point. They’re still brand new because i barely use them for fear I’ll lose them.

Honestly, I believe that purchasing this product has been a complete waste of money because I am still trying to find that good quality/magical music sound that is so widely talked about. My old apple wired earbuds sound way better plus, they keep popping out of my ears. The most feasible way to keep them secured in my ears is if I’m wearing a head wrap to pull down over the buds.

reviewTitle: Love these! So glad I decided to buy
reviewDescription: I had the 2nd gen & loved those but my husband borrowed them & broke one. So I decided to upgrade. Headphones with the rubber tips never stay in my ears so I decided to go with these 3rd gens. I love them and the sound quality is amazing. But they don’t seem to fit as well in my ears as the 2nd gens. These seem a little bigger and it’s hard to keep them in place if I’m talking or eating while wearing them. Another thing I don’t like is that you no longer tap to pause, it’s a little awkward to find the button on the AirPod. I purchased a used pair marked “acceptable” so I was nervous they’d be beat up or dirty. They came in in the box in perfect condition. They looked brand new & they’re still covered until Apple warranty until 10/24. For anyone whose hesitant to buy a used pair — don’t be. I saved $60 and they looked brand new even though they were marked as acceptable. Highly recommend even if there are a few small cons :)

reviewTitle: The best apple audio product by far!
reviewDescription: I got these as a christmas present and these are the best Apple audio product they have. I have tried their Airpod Max's and they are not worth anywhere near the price these are worth. These AirPods are super cool. They're super easy to set up with my iPhone, and the sound is amazing!  Plus, they're comfy to wear, and not complicated to change the settings. The best part is that they last all day, and the case charges them up super fast. Whether I'm listening to music, playing games, or chatting with friends, these AirPods are my go-to. If you want sound and reliable headphones, these are the ones to get!

Comfortable, Clear, and Convenient.Comfort, clear sound, and convenience. Excellent sound quality perfect for music, calls, and everything in between. Durable and reliable, they're the ideal companion for your everyday adventures.

reviewTitle: If You're Not Sure, This is Your Sign to BUY
reviewDescription: I was looking to replace my 2nd gen, when I saw these were on sale.  Between the sale and my rewards, the 3rd and 2nd gen were the same price so I treated myself.  I'm so glad I did! It's a little adjustment getting used to the different size.  They kind of felt like they weren't secure in my ear but they were, and never fell out.The sound quality is great.  I don't know any other way to describer, other than saying it felt like the sound was all around me and not just in my ear.  I was waiting on my car to be serviced, watching a show on my iPad.  I was so paranoid and kept taking one out.  I just new they weren't paired properly and everyone in the waiting room could hear my loud tv show.  That's how good the sound is.

reviewTitle: Great quality but hurt my ears and didn’t stay in
reviewDescription: Don’t get me wrong, the quality of these earbuds are great. They just wouldn’t stay in my ears. No matter how I tried to love them they just ended up popping out. Initially I wanted a pair for when I’m working out so as my music isn’t blaring for everyone else to hear. I ended up giving them to my son who is now enjoying his Moms unfortunate circumstances. He’s really happy with them.

These AirPods are no exception. The fit takes some getting used to. Being my first pair I felt I had to  be careful of not losing one. In fact the portability feature of their compact profile and to this loss preventative anxiety. I’m confident I’ll get better accustomed to them as they’re worth it. Like all Mac products (I own, MacAir Pro, watch, iPhone and other accessories services and apps) work exceptionally well right out of the box, they’re easy to configure, and the fact they all work so well together add even greater value.  Worth noting I was a reluctant converted PC user from as early as DOS 5.

reviewTitle: Don’t Buy, Fall Out; Stick with Gen 2!
reviewDescription: I would have rated these 3 stars, but figured 5 would get more views to inform people.The Oval shape, makes them feel like they’re going to fall out, before you start moving. - having to ‘click’ the short stem, really makes them fall out.The primary problem is, by the time you’ve’Grabbed it’ & ‘Clicked it’, you’ve ‘Dislodged it’ & need to ‘Reinsert it’. Repeatably.I often have gloves, dirty gloves, or dirty hands, getting me or them dirty trying to click the audio controls.Just as pleasurable as it is to listen to someone’s loud personal cellphone calls, that’s similar to listening to someone barking out Siri commands all day… it gets lots of comments from unsuspecting listeners, colleagues, & clients. I prefer the light touch. I can control them with the back of my hand, wrist, or shoulder.I’ve used many sets of AirPod Gen 2;  if you have, you barely tap them to control them.For 3rd Gen Spatial AirPods Apple says to place your thumb behind the stem and slide your index finger along the “Force Detector”. (FYI, a force detector, is just a click switch, just like a mouse… just say that). What it should really say is, ‘click it like a mouse’.“Apple’s Support” typically gives stupid names and directions. If I’m ever looking for help on Apple Products, I do all I can to avoid their support directions because they rarely help directly. I look for “Real, Normal” people answers on YouTube or Quora.They sound great! Just don’t move.

reviewTitle: There is nothing better in the market
reviewDescription: There is nothing bad about these headphone. There is literally no downside to airpods pro.here is why :1- 30 hours battery backup. Makes it perfect pair for listing to music entire day2- quick charging.. so that you are always covered3- its sturdy.. and durable.. highly reliable4- its a perfect giftmost importantly: ITS INVESTMENT! I don't think I will need another headphone in near future.

so glad i decided to splurge on these beauties. i've been struggling to find wireless earbuds that 1) sound good and 2) actually connect to my phone 😵‍💫 these fit the bill 1000%. absolutely no issues connecting and the sound quality is out of this world! they also fit my ears perfectly (super comfy) but i can see how the size might be an issue if you have petite ear holes. i've only been using them for a day so i can't speak on battery life just yet, but it seems that they'll last quite a while on one charge. yea if you have an iphone and don't have airpods yet, wtf are you doing !!!

Nothing to dislike. Been using corded headphones for far too long. I tried the inner ear Dre beats but the cord wasn’t long enough and would stick to my neck during workouts. Decided to get 2 of these for myself and wife. If you’re thinking about it, buy them. I got them on sale, I don’t even know the luck behind it, better price than what Amazon day and Black Friday prices were. They are great.

Bought these to replace my Sennheiser headset that didn't have any noise cancellation. For as many folks I see wearing these things, I took it for granted that these would work for me, as well.My beef with them is that they do not stay put in my ears. They fall out. That sucks. To fix that, I bought some silicone devices that I thought would work. As long as I sit still, they work work well, but moving around or even walking gently is risking having them fall out of my ears.As far as sound quality, they sound pretty good. Noise cancellation, I am told by people I am on calls with, is better than the 20 year old Sennheisers. Integration with a WinTel device and iPhone was super easy..Battery life for me is more than adequate. Charging time seems really fast.Overall, I would not recommend buying the Gen3 Airpods. I will not buy them again.

reviewTitle: Apple AirPods (3rd Gen): Worthy Upgrade or Overpriced Tweak?
reviewDescription: The 3rd Gen AirPods refine the formula, but is it enough to warrant the upgrade? Here's a quick rundown:Pros:Improved Sound: Fuller bass and crisper highs deliver a more enjoyable listening experience compared to the 2nd Gen.Spatial Audio Immersion: Head-tracking Spatial Audio adds a cinematic touch to compatible content, especially movies and music videos.Comfy Fit: Slightly redesigned fit sits more securely while remaining comfortable for extended wear.Sweatproof Durability: IPX4 rating makes them resistant to splashes and light workouts.Seamless Apple Integration: Easy pairing, automatic switching between devices, and convenient Siri access remain unmatched in the Apple ecosystem.Cons:Price Tag: At $179, they're still a premium option compared to other wireless earbuds.No Noise Cancellation: This deal-breaker for some can't be justified by the slight sonic improvements.Mediocre Call Quality: Mic performance is still just decent, not great for noisy environments.Lightning Only: No USB-C charging might irk some, especially Android users.Limited Design Change: Not a drastic departure from the 2nd Gen, which might disappoint those seeking a fresh look.Verdict:For die-hard Apple users and audiophiles seeking a subtle sound upgrade, the 3rd Gen AirPods offer a decent improvement. But for those on a budget, needing active noise cancellation, or wanting a more dramatic design shift, looking elsewhere might be wiser.Overall Rating: 3.5 out of 5 stars

reviewTitle: Massively Big In Your Ears Falls Out
reviewDescription: While the spacial sound is a nice perk, it’s not worth the money over the Gen 2. While neither Gen 2 nor Gen 3 have active noise cancelation, since Gen 3 have a looser fit and leave more room between your ear canal, outside noise like people speaking or gym radio is approximately 35% louder than Gen 2.  The ear piece itself is much larger than previous models. I have a big head and big ears, and these feel like they’re about to fall out constantly.  Definitely do not fit snuggly in your ear even after learning you should twist the pod slightly upward towards your face. Apple removed the tap controls and replace with a physical plastic button that you have to hold with 2 fingers, otherwise pushing it with one finger could cause the unit to fall out. I’m still within my 30 days and highly considering sending back and getting the Gen 2 again.  Apple… do better.  Your plastic toys are too expensive to be this poorly designed.

reviewTitle: Ordering from Amazon does not provide the same quality level of support as ordering through Apple
reviewDescription: After I finally realized that I could not get the apple AirPods Generation 3 to fit my ears, it was beyond the Return Date. Fifteen days wasn't enough time for me. So, decided to plead my case to Apple and Amazon respective Customer Support. Apple attempted to be helpful to allow a return; however, apple could not provide a Return label because Apple Post-Sales Support needed an Apple Store (online or brick-mortar) Order number and because the product was ordered through Amazon, I only had Amazon order number. My only option per Apple and Amazon was to go to a physical AppleStore and plead my case.Perhaps typical post-return date' issues, there is no difference when ordering from Amazon or direct through Apple. However, it was an unexpected difference in this case and knowing this before purchase would have been helpful.

Apple loves to make everything shiny and smooth intentionally so we lose or drop their devices and have to buy replacements.  It’s my right ear.  The AirPod kept falling out constantly! Yes these work great the sound is amazing the base is incredible I was so happy until the right one kept falling out on to the ground.  So if you have had issues with AirPods  staying in your ear don’t buy these.Thanks an apple Thanks for making phones so smooth they fly out of hands and break.  Thanks for making AirPods so smooth they fall out and get lost.  They make billions in damaged product they’re not about to stop.  They know what they’re doing.  I returned them next day.  Apple, make the material rougher so they stay in the ear.  Or hire a designer with bigger ears so they make these slightly bigger next generation!

Ive had 2nd and 3rd gen, and I could say that I liked the most the 2nd one.1- On this 3rd gen, you have to press a button to command it. The 2nd gen was about a simple touch. 2nd gen win!2- you can recognize the spatial audio on 3rd gen but it doesnt feel that the sound quality is as clear as the 2nd gen.2nd gen win!The 3rd gen supposed to be an upgrade of the 2nd, but instead I feel that it doesn’t. There’s a few things the company should consider, specially making the sound much clearer.

I’ve been so frustrated with these headphones the left side consistently won’t charge ! I will leave them in the case all day and plug the case in and it only charges when when it feels like it. Has something to do with there “ optimize battery” feature which who cares about if your headphines are dead every time you go to the gym! Honestly just Over priced headphones that don’t work properly sound quality is okay spend your money elsewhere you can get a better deal and better quality

Great sound quality and love that they are more compact than the last generation. My only complaint is that it does not have adjustable ear sizing. I have small ears and they do not sit comfortably. They are much too large for my ears and always feel like they are going to fall out of my ears. They are fine for working or poolside, but would never wear them to exercise in fear of losing them.

Apple’s AirPods are truly revolutionary. With a sleek design, exceptional sound quality, and seamless integration with Apple devices, they elevate the listening experience to a whole new level. The convenience of AirPods is unparalleled, thanks to their instant connectivity and impressive battery life. Moreover, their active noise cancellation technology provides complete sonic immersion, making them ideal for use in any environment. If you value quality, convenience, and style, AirPods are definitely the right choice.

Just got these in and tried them. Have had all generations now. Without the ear tip piece like the others these fall out with ease and are quite uncomfortable. Sound clarity is great even without the noice cancellation option which I was sad to find out these don’t have either. I’ll have to use my Gen 2 for workouts and these for leisure.

I upgraded to these from gen 1 air pods. In terms of battery life, sound quality and phone call quality these blow the gen 1s away. The spatial audio feature is pretty neat and is a noticeable difference. I mostly use these for phone calls, whether I’m on teams meetings or having personal conversations. I’ve had people mention how much clearer I sound and how there’s zero background noise thru these vs my old one (that’s saying a lot as I’ll be in meetings while out in the chemical plants). They’re super easy to use. Just open the case and pair them, you can switch over to them during a live call or meeting in a matter of seconds.Now on to the bad; these suckers are waayy bigger than the gen 1s. With all the good I mentioned, if you have smaller ears I would 1000% not recommend these. They can start to hurt insanely bad and that’s if they stay in your ears. Through talking and walking they constantly fall out of my ears. I work at a chemical plant and wearing hearing protection is a normal everyday thing, so I know how to properly insert things into your ear but these guys will not stay in. Then falling out your instict is to catch them and push them back in, but the touch buttons pick that up to hang up your phone call or kick you from your meeting, there is a setting to change the hang up touch from 1 touch to 2 touches- thankfully. The gen1 air pods fit perfectly, idk why it didn’t occur to me that they would change the ear bud size that drastically.2 lessons I learned-1) don’t take all the good reviews for granted and wait to try them incase you have to return them2) these will be the last headphones I buy that don’t have rubber ear buds to allow for size adjustabilityOverall a great buy if you have normal to large ear canals. If you prefer the small rubber ear bud adapter on other headphones DO NOT BUY.

reviewTitle: Amazing sound but shape hurts my ears a bit
reviewDescription: I love Apple products but to be honest my latest AirPods are slightly disappointing. Unfortunately the shape does not fit comfortably in my smaller ears. They feel uncomfortable and a bit large. Sound is great! Talk is great. Just large

Someone recommended the Pro version of these to me, but I was cheap and didn't want to spend the extra money. It really bugs me to have to buy these anyway with the newer phones, but we are stuck. Well, now that I bought them, I learned they can not be returned but these are incredibly uncomfortable! I can only stand to wear for them for a short time before I have to take them out and give my ears a rest. I alternate left and right so keep them from hurting, but it's pretty bad. In addition, they fall out all the time. I'm sure I will lose these eventually. It's really a bad design forcing us to spend more money just to have the ability to assure comfort. I am so sorry I bought these!

I bought these for my daughter because I thought a newer gen product would be better. And in some aspects they are. She complained about these “hurting” her ears, so I bought her the 2nd gen pros and kept these for myself. I guess it depends on someone’s ear size and shape, but these were also harder to keep in my ears and were not comfortable. Im hoping there may be a way to add a more flexible silicon cover with smaller tip to add better fit and comfort. The sound quality is there, just a comfort issue. I should have read the reviews which explained this. My bad.

They are good 👍🏾 I like the sound and Spatial Audio and also like that they are wireless for charging. I gave it 4 stars because they are not comfortable in the ears and they also fall out so if you have a small ear canal you might have to purchase some ear tips on Amazon for them, besides that I would recommend

I wanted to try the newer set to see if the quality has improved.  It absolutely has.  There's more base coming through.  It's great for EDM.  That said, they have one major drawback.  They are much wider than the previous versions and fall out of my ears constantly.  I decided to by the silicone covers in the hopes that they keep them in my ears.  So far they do.  We'll see how it works when mountain biking.  For additional data, I'm a female of average height and weight.  There's nothing unusual about my ears.

reviewTitle: Falls out of your ear way too easily.
reviewDescription: These have some good sound, but it's our 3rd pair because they fall out so easily and get lost/ruined.  If the wind catches them just right while biking, along with the sweat, they seem to come out pretty easily.  We might switch back to the Android version we had since they stayed in our ear just fine.  However the build quality is great with these and the sound is top notch - I just wish they had some kind of silicon body or wrap to make them stickier.

reviewTitle: Great sound.  A little bit thicker than the prevous generations
reviewDescription: They have a great sound, but they are a little thicker in the ear than the previous generations.  As a result, they don't seem to fit as well.  They still stay in the ear, but I feel that I need to push them in periodically.  Putting them in vertically, then twisting the airpod bottom towards your nose helps.

reviewTitle: Crystal Clear Sound with Comfortable Fit!
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) and have been thoroughly impressed with their performance. The personalized spatial audio is a game-changer—it feels like I'm in my own personal concert hall with a full range of sound that is just astonishing. The earbuds fit snugly and comfortably in my ears, and I've had no issues with them falling out, even during my morning jogs, thanks to the sweat and water-resistant design.Bluetooth connectivity is seamless, with no noticeable lag when I'm watching videos or taking calls. Speaking of calls, the call quality is pristine; I've received comments on how clear I sound. The battery life is also a standout feature; I can go nearly a full day without needing to recharge, and with the charging case, I have up to 30 hours of listening time, which is perfect for long trips.The only slight downside is that they don't have active noise cancellation, but the sound quality and spatial audio more than make up for it. They're so intuitive to use—just a simple setup with my iPhone and I was good to go. The Lightning Charging Case is a sleek and convenient way to keep the earbuds powered, and it's small enough to slip into my pocket.Overall, the AirPods (3rd Generation) have been an excellent purchase, providing a combination of great sound quality, ease of use, and robust battery life. They're an ideal choice for anyone looking to upgrade their listening experience. Highly recommend!
The rechargable case is nice. The battery life so far has been great. They do often feel like they're about to fall out of my ears, but they haven't fallen out yet!

I use these every single day! They are light weight and sit in the ear perfectly. The battery on them is incredible compared to my previous ones. I would recommend these headphones over any on the market right now.

The difference in battery life is at least double. I’m in long calls (2hrs) often and was very impressed by the battery life. After I bought the 2nd gen I went back to wired. Once I bought these I haven’t used them since. Expect 3 hrs of voice call use before putting it back in the case to recharge.

First pair was bought at Walmart and wouldn’t charge properly. Was going to take them to the Apple Store but they got washed in the washer. This pair works great and they are comfortable and sound great
they aren’t better than the pro edition but it’s a nice upgrade for gen 1
i got it for my grandson,he likes them

Very great deal and  great product.
the sound quality is soo good and i love the feel of the 3rd gen pros bc it dosent have that rubber piece at the end, love these.

These are great they’re great product for using just about everyone using flying traveling everything they’re just wonderful definitely would recommend getting some AirPods for anything you need out there

I liked that I could run and workout all the while  keeping the AirPods in my ear.I thought that by them having a weird shape that u would run into many issues with them falling out but they don’t so I would definitely recommend.
Buen artículo, buena calidad. Buen precio. Lo recomiendo!
Perfect

I truly did need these for work. My job requires me to use ear buds and none of the other ones I had purchased were good enough quality. This is the best for any iPhone user. Don’t buy off brand for sure 10/10 recommend these AirPods

I've used them twice and they fit perfectly and I'm happy with the sound. I like that I can walk around without worrying they'll fall out. I actually have another brand of earbuds that are so big they fall out if I turn my head.

Husband got them for me for Christmas and they are awesome!! If you take one out the other one will pause the music and you can change what you’re listening to by tapping the bottom part. reviewTitle: Immerse Yourself in Wireless Audio Bliss - Apple AirPods Redefine the Earbud Experience
reviewDescription: The Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) are the epitome of wireless earbuds, delivering a remarkable audio experience that combines convenience, style, and cutting-edge technology. With their sleek design, seamless connectivity, and impressive sound quality, these earbuds take your music, calls, and entertainment to a whole new level.The standout feature of the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) is their effortless wireless connectivity. Simply open the charging case near your iPhone or any other Apple device, and the earbuds instantly connect, ready to deliver your favorite tunes. With the Apple H1 chip, the AirPods offer a stable and reliable wireless connection, ensuring uninterrupted audio streaming and crystal-clear calls.The AirPods (3rd Generation) are designed to fit comfortably in your ears, thanks to their ergonomic and lightweight construction. They come with three different sizes of silicone ear tips, allowing you to find the perfect fit for enhanced comfort and a secure seal. Whether you're running, working out, or simply going about your day, the AirPods stay in place, providing a hassle-free and comfortable listening experience.When it comes to sound quality, the AirPods (3rd Generation) excel. The custom-designed high-excursion drivers deliver immersive sound with rich bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. Whether you're listening to your favorite music genres, podcasts, or audiobooks, the AirPods reproduce the audio with impressive clarity and detail, allowing you to immerse yourself in your content.The Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) feature built-in beamforming microphones and an updated speech-detecting accelerometer, ensuring clear and natural-sounding calls. Whether you're taking work calls or catching up with friends, the AirPods capture your voice with precision and minimize background noise, providing a seamless and efficient communication experience.Siri, Apple's voice assistant, is always just a "Hey Siri" away with the AirPods (3rd Generation). With hands-free access to Siri, you can ask for directions, control your music, send messages, and more, all without reaching for your iPhone. The voice-activated convenience adds another layer of functionality to these earbuds, making them a true smart companion for your daily tasks.The AirPods (3rd Generation) offer impressive battery life, keeping you entertained and connected throughout the day. With up to six hours of listening time on a single charge and an additional 24 hours of battery life provided by the charging case, you can enjoy your music, podcasts, and calls without worrying about running out of power. The quick charging feature provides hours of use with just a few minutes of charging.With their seamless integration into the Apple ecosystem, the AirPods (3rd Generation) offer a seamless and effortless user experience. They automatically sync with all your Apple devices, allowing you to switch between them seamlessly. Whether you're listening to music on your iPhone, watching a movie on your iPad, or making a call on your Mac, the AirPods connect effortlessly, providing a truly wireless and versatile audio solution.In conclusion, the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) redefine the earbud experience with their sleek design, effortless wireless connectivity, and impressive sound quality. Whether you're a music enthusiast, a busy professional, or an on-the-go individual, these earbuds offer convenience, comfort, and outstanding audio performance. Immerse yourself in wireless audio bliss with the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) and elevate your everyday listening experience.

reviewTitle: AirPods 3rd Gen: The Earbuds That Have It All (Except Maybe a Coffee Maker)
reviewDescription: In the whirlwind of technology and endless gadget releases, Apple's AirPods (3rd Generation) stand out like a beacon of simplicity and sophistication - much like a well-written piece of code in a sea of programming chaos. As someone who's no stranger to the tech world (hello, countless hours of coding and debugging), I've found these AirPods to be an essential accessory, almost as crucial as my laptop.First off, let's talk about the personalized spatial audio. It's like having a surround sound theater plugged directly into your ears, minus the bulky headphones and popcorn kernels. Whether I'm immersing myself in my favorite tunes to escape the monotony of debugging or catching up on tech podcasts, the sound quality is nothing short of stellar. It's an auditory experience that makes you question if these earbuds secretly house a team of tiny musicians.Sweat and water-resistant? Absolutely. For someone living in sunny and sometimes sweaty Florida, this feature is a godsend. It means I can go from a coding marathon at the University of Florida to a literal marathon (or, let's be real, a brisk walk) without worrying about my earbuds throwing in the towel before I do.The convenience of the Lightning Charging Case is like having a portable power bank specifically for your earbuds. It's compact, efficient, and ensures that my AirPods are always ready for action - much like my trusty laptop, always charged for those unexpected coding sessions.Now, let's talk battery life. Up to 30 hours? That's longer than some of my longest coding sessions (which is saying something). It's reassuring to know that my AirPods will likely outlast my laptop's battery and my own energy levels.In the world of Bluetooth headphones, the AirPods 3rd Gen are like the sleek, high-performing sports car everyone wants to drive. They pair seamlessly with my devices, ensuring I'm always just a tap away from crystal-clear audio, whether I'm taking calls or drowning out background noise to focus on my work.In conclusion, Apple's AirPods (3rd Generation) are more than just earbuds; they're a lifestyle upgrade. For tech enthusiasts, coders, or just about anyone who appreciates quality sound and convenience, these AirPods are a must-have in 2023.

reviewTitle: Nowhere near the fit of the 2nd gen.
reviewDescription: One of my current (2nd gen) AirPods only holds charge for about 20 minutes now.. so instead of paying $50 for Apple to replace 1 AirPod I decided to upgrade and managed to get the 3rd gen for $129 on prime day.These are larger than the 2nd generation - As a result, if I’m doing anything other than sitting or laying still I will feel them slowly moving towards the outside of my ear and I will have to push them in again.If I’m running or holding things then good luck not having them drop on the ground..I tried adjusting them according to the Apple instructions but nothing seems to be keeping them in place. They are just not as snug as the previous generation.The sound is AWESOME but unfortunately due to the poor fit I will be returning and reordering a new pair of the 2nd gen :(

Further, the stems on them are shorter and the "tap" feature from the 2nd Gen has been replaced with a button you press on the shortened stems.  So every time I reach to squeeze the stem to push the button they fall out even more easily.  The "tap" feature would at least reinforce keeping them in my ears!I'm returning and ordering a new set of the 2nd Gen and will wait until I kill those in a year or two.  These newer ones are just not a good fit for me.

Returned them the next day and ordered another pairs of Gen 2. Sound quality doesn't matter much if it doesn't stay in your ears. I am a male and don't have small ears. This is the first Apple product that I disliked. Apple, please don't stop producing Gen 2 AirPods.

You can't do it with one finger so you have to basically pinch the stem, which just loosens the thing from your ear (see problem #1).Stickin' with 2nd gen...just wish they weren't so long and dorky looking.

reviewDescription: I had the 2nd Generation AirPods which I lost in an airport.  I should have reordered the 2nd Generation, but decided to step up to the 3rd Generation. Also, the 2nd generation charging cable was USB on one end so I could plug it in my computer to charge the AirPods. 3rd generation is lighting, and I don't have that port on my computer.  3rd Generation has a longer charge from the description, and that would have been very nice; however, they just didn't work for me.  I ordered a replacement 2nd Generation, since I like my AirPods.

The AirPod box was greasy and looked old but unopened. I was also told it would require a signature when delivered but instead it was just left at front door where anyone could have taken it. Just because the delivery driver took a photo of it at my front door does not mean that it was properly delivered.

reviewTitle: Defective, Return Policy not what I expected.
reviewDescription: I already own a pair of the Gen.3 Airpods. I like them, so I decided to purchase a pair for my wife for Xmas. No problems pairing with her Iphone or charging with the provided cable, but the case would not charge wirelessly. I tried doing a factory reset and also tried using 3 different wireless chargers. All of the chargers worked with my own Airpods, but not with the new ones. OK, I understand that these things happen. Amazon returns have always been easy for me, but not this time. When I initiated the return process, I found that this item cannot be returned by dropping them off at a UPS store using a QR code. I had to initiate a chat with an Amazon representative, who told me the ONLY way to return the Airpods was to have them picked up at my home by UPS. This makes no sense to me, as it would have been a lot more convenient for me to drop them off at UPS myself. I was more than willing to do that, but that wasn't an option..... So right now I'm sitting home all day waiting for UPS to bring a shipping label and pick them up. Hopefully UPS will show up. Complete waste of my time.

reviewTitle: Product defective and the refund delayed yet again
reviewDescription: AirPods did not charge even though it was a returned item before by previous customer and  Amazon stated the item was ‘like new’. I initiated the return within 36 hours of receiving the defective item. The AirPods were picked by UPS on the second day later. Amazon has had this item in their possession from the start of return at 6 days. First refund of monies was after the AirPods were sitting for 17 days in the warehouse. (yesterday) Now today they have delayed for another 3 days overwritten with a new date like the previous one never existed. And now it has been delayed once again to 4 weeks of having the AirPods returned.Really Amazon? Like I and my family only spend multiple thousands of dollars with you every year.I would recommend that customers get their AirPods direct from Apple instead of having their money tied up by Amazon on the chance that the item proves defective.February 8th I still have not gotten my refund

reviewTitle: NO MAGSAFE!! Cannot return. Buyer beware.
reviewDescription: The AirPods themselves sound and perform flawlessly, just as you’d expect from the AirPod line. The issue I have is that every review I have ever read or seen says that AirPods 3 are MagSafe and Qi wireless charging compatible. These are a sneaky ‘save-a-buck’ option Apple released without telling anyone. So they have a lightning charging port, but no wireless and no magnets to stick to a MagSafe charger.The next issue is that there is no easy way to return them via Amazon. They want you to troubleshoot the item and it’s an endless loop that keeps telling you to try something different instead of just letting you return.I will never buy another Apple product off their Amazon store again. Waste of life.

These were purchased in October as a Christmas present at one of Amazon's sales but they were not opened until Christmas and that is when we discovered they do not fit, they fall out of your ears very easily. The return window was 2 weeks later which I did not realize at the time so BUYER BEWARE!!. I called Amazon customer service and explained the issue and was told sorry I can not do anything for you. I told customer service I wanted to purchase a different model but I was still told that they could not help me. I have learned the hard way not to purchase your grandchildren Christmas presents in a timely manner but to wait until just before and hope they are not out of stock or you are out of luck returning it. If Amazon customer service could help me with this I would really appreciate someone getting in touch with me.

reviewTitle: Returns are a nightmare with Amazon
reviewDescription: The AirPods are great. However the 3rd generation has a wired lighting cable charging case that’s not wireless charging compatible and a wireless charging MagSafe case that’s more expensive but worth it if you invested in wireless charging.FYI if you figured out the difficult way you got the wrong AirPod edition, Amazon’s return for AirPods is different from most other things. If you set up a return you have to call them to authorize the return and then they set up a delivery with ups with no time except the next day. The drivers will attempt 3 other days. I call ups and they don’t give me any window except be on standby till 7. No option to drop it off at a ups store. Absolutely a nightmare. So you’re better off just going to an Apple Store than dealing with Amazon.

The product description says up to 6 hours listening time.  they definitely did not last that long for me. I’ve tried it several times I would say tops they made it to about 2 1/2 hours I received them on February 5 I reached out to Amazon on February 24 and they would not help me so now I am stuck with AirPods that are not great. If I had to do it again, I would certainly not buy AirPods from Amazon again I would just go straight to Apple Store.  There was no benefit or advantage to using Amazon. I really regret this purchase.

I bought mine refurbished as it was slightly cheaper, turns out that once an Apple product has been connected to someone’s iCloud account, only they can remove the item. When I received my pair of headphones they worked fine but I eventually got a pop up later in the day informing me that they were connected to a different iCloud account. It turns out the previous owner still had them connected and could see where they were, this means my location was being shared with someone. I immediately turned them off and contacted Amazon. Amazon did not see the location tracking as big of an issue as I did and requested I return them. After the whole process was completed, I was informed I needed to wait longer for a refund as the Apple product refund process is more difficult and complicated. BUY THEM NEW.

What a waste. For the money that Apple charges for these 3rd Generation AirPods, they truly aren't worth the investment. I purchased these because I was looking for improved sound from my 2nd Generation AirPods. First, the sound is a very slight improvement over the 2nd Generation AirPods and definitely not worth the extra $$. However, several months after purchase, the AirPods started experiencing intermittent charging issues. I spent hours on the phone with Apple Support trying to fix the issue with no luck. Finally, they had me send the AirPods back to Apple for bench testing. What a waste of time, Apple plugged the unit into their bench testing unit and determined that there was nothing wrong, they literally had the AirPods for two hours and returned them without being repaired or replaced. Several days ago, after one week of non use of the AirPods, I went to use them. Once again, the AirPods were at zero charge, even though the case showed 63% battery. These things are expensive, yet Apple doesn’t support the product, and they simply don’t work. Also, their bench test is a complete joke. I’ve provided photographic proof of the issue, yet Apple continues to deny and accept their responsibility for shoddy manufacturing, oversight, and quality control, even though these AirPods are still under warranty. Bottom line, don’t waste your time or money on this poorly designed, manufactured & supported product. In the future, I'll take a very long look at competitors products before purchasing another Apple product again.

reviewTitle: A Symphony of Innovation and Quality: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation)
reviewDescription: Purchasing the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) from Amazon was an absolute breeze, and the moment they arrived, I could not wait to experience the audio magic I had heard so much about. Right out of the elegantly designed box, these AirPods exuded a premium feel, synonymous with Apple's reputation for quality and innovation.Pairing them with my device via Bluetooth was effortless and instantaneous, paving the way for a remarkable auditory journey. The personalized spatial audio is nothing short of revolutionary, encapsulating a surround sound experience that makes you feel at the center of your music, podcasts, or calls. The clarity and richness of sound are unparalleled, providing a depth of audio that is crisp, balanced, and utterly immersive.Comfort is evidently a priority in the design of these AirPods. They nestle into the ears comfortably, providing a secure fit without any sense of intrusion or discomfort, even during extended use. The sweat and water resistance feature is a practical addition, making them my go-to choice for workouts, runs, or even a walk in the drizzle.The battery life is impressive, providing up to 30 hours of playback time with the lightning charging case. This ensures that my audio companion is ready to serenade me throughout the day without any interruptions. The case itself is compact and sleek, making it easy to carry around.Charging is quick and efficient with the lightning charger, ensuring that I'm back to my audio haven in no time. The intuitive touch controls on the AirPods are responsive, making it easy to control playback, answer calls, or activate Siri for hands-free functionality.In summary, the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) is an epitome of what modern audio technology should be—effortless, robust, and delivering a superior sound experience. They have become an indispensable part of my daily life, whether I am on the move, working out, or simply unwinding to my favorite tunes. The satisfaction derived from the product, coupled with the seamless purchase experience on Amazon, adds to the allure of owning these extraordinary wireless earbuds.

I purchased these with the intention of upgrading from my very worn 1st generation AirPods that I bought refurbished. They worked great, just were starting to get a little grody. There are a number of issues with the 3rd generation AirPod pros that make them basically unusable.1. The background/ambient noise is amplified through the microphone. If you’re talking on the phone, the person at the other end is assaulted by any small noises going on in your background. So if you’re loading the dishwasher, taking out trash, or god forbid TYPING on a keyboard the other person will hear those things MORE than your voice. Apple support seems to know this is an issue, and all the “fixes” have done nothing.2. The tap sensors do not work. I used these on my 1st Gen model to pause music and hang up the phone. These sensors are not responsive to do either of the functions even though they are enabled on the settings.3. The AirPods will randomly disconnect and reconnect. There seems to be no rhyme or reason as to why or when this will happen.Needless to say, I am disappointed that I thought this would be an upgrade. I thought that the stereo sound would be cool, and it is, but not cool enough for me to overlook the other issues. Wish I could return, but no luck with an opened/used product here.

You can no longer tap-touch to switch songs, you have to press the physical button or use Siri to switch songs. The button sits against your face, so in order to hit it you have to move it away from your face, which then forces you to reposition the AirPods again in your ear; a tedious process.You can see in the photo that the new ones are much larger and oblong shaped. Shame.And now I noticed the right earbud has a static noise that I’ll always notice. Nope, these are now my backup AirPods. Sad.

reviewTitle: They do not fit at all like the 2nd generation model!
reviewDescription: I had to replace my 2nd gen AirPods so I stepped up and am very sorry I did.  They are incredibly uncomfortable and fall out of my ears.  They are larger than the previous model, and were a huge waste of money.  I can tell that the sound quality is better than my previous ones, but it doesn’t matter because they just don’t work for me.

I've had cheap 60 dollar too earbids sound 10x better then these 3rd gen ipoo's. They barely set in my ears without wanting to fall out and there is no right bass to these turds. Not to mention no wireless charging. Come on apple all the above you get with almost any brand now a days and yet you charge 150.90 dollars. What a joke..

We bought this with the assumption that all of the 3rd gen AirPods came with a wireless charging case and these do not.  If you are looking for wireless charging, look elsewhere and don't waste your money!
I would not buy these again the consistanly fall out of the ear . Very frustrating
The quality of these is fine, but they definitely sent gen 2 AirPods and not gen 3.

I bought these after the microphones went out on my old 2nd gen pair, which I had for over 2 years and used quite a bit. I loved that pair but wanted to try an upgraded version. Not a fan of how these 3rd gen fit in my ears. I only tried them for about an hour and decided to return them. They constantly felt like they were going to fall out, and at one point one of them did fall out when I bent over. I purchased another 2nd gen pair because they fit me significantly better and are durable if you take care of them
The font fit properly

reviewTitle: Hurts my ears, but overall great!
reviewDescription: I don’t really know but these headphones hurt my ears when having them in for a hour or so. It could be because I’m not really a AirPod person but they do cause a little discomfort. They have spatial audio which is amazing when your watching a movie, it gives you feel like your at a movie theatre. These headphones have good battery life and good  sound.

Great for making phone calls and listening to music in a quiet place. Not great on the plane and isn’t effective for cancelling noise. Overall nice headphones for the money, just understand their limitations.
I like them a lot, my only exception is that they are chunkier than the AirPods 2 so they fit a bit big on my ears and tend to slip off.
But for me personally, they fall out of my ears. Annoying. The older version with the longer outside ear part is my go to. But the sound is good.

Awesome product. The sound quality is great, and the battery life is amazing, among other things. However, there's one major issue I have with this product - the earphones won't stay in my ears. Even a slight movement of my head causes them to start falling out. I regret choosing these instead of the second-generation ones, which worked much better for me.I already lost one a couple of month into owning them and switched back to my 4 year old second generation airpods :(
These iPod-EarPods, or whatever they’re called work just fine. The previous ones worked good too, until they didn’t.

The sound quality is what I noticed first about these Airpods.  After owning various other brands over the years, the sound caught me off guard as I didn't expect such theater quality sound.  Easy to adjust in the ear so they won't fall out and works well with iPhone notification alerts - location, battery, tips on how to use.  I also like the shorter stem.

Quality- they were great, they're airpods. I thought they were going to be different than the original airpods and overall they were pretty much the same. I ended up returning them because they are slightly bigger than the original ones and they hurt my ears. I'm sure my ears would have gotten use to them, but instead I ordred the original model.
I do wish they had some adjustability at the ear with maybe a silicone piece but I love them anyway. They do slide out occasionally when working out.
Very comfortable while wearing them in your ear. Sound is very good.

Getting a refund is like pulling teeth.I decided to try the airpods after the rave reviews of my friends. But they didn't fit me ears so I started the return process. Very strict return policy didn't allow me to drop them off at a UPS store but I had to leave the return outside my front door without a shipping label. After seeing no action on the return I called Amazon. They were able to confirm with UPS that the package was delivered. They then put me on hold to talk with Apple. They were able to confirm with Apple that they did receive the package and it would take 7 to 10 days for a refund. So, I waited!After two more weeks of waiting, I called Amazon again and explained the situation. They put me on hold to talk to Apple. I was told that Apple takes a month to issue refunds, but since the shipping process started a month ago, I should be receiving my refund tomorrow. Well, it's been a week and I'm still waiting on my refund from Apple.How are they so big if this is how they treat their customers? I'm still waiting!

reviewTitle: Unfortunately I missed the return deadline by just a few days...
reviewDescription: These hurt my ears so bad after just 30 to 45 minutes of wear. I don't think these are one-size-fits-all. These have no noise cancelling ability at all, I had to have the volume up to 80% or more to hear anything at all through these things when I'm on a plane. I wish I could return them and get my money back.

On the description it said the product was new, but it was actually a used AirPod. One of the the EarPods didn’t work, I immediately return the product and the refund has taken over 3 weeks, they got the AirPods on the Jan 3 and it’s the Jan 26th and still I haven’t got my refund they keep changing the date . The worst part of it, it was supposed to be a Christmas gift for my goddaughter. I’m so disappointed.

If you have any issue with the airpod it will be a huge pain to return. Do not buy air pods from Amazon, it is not worth it. Apple make it almost impossible to return products even if they are prime.  You only have 2 weeks to return them instead of the typical 30 days, ups driver has to come to your house, you can not return the item from a ups store or partner store so if you work good luck. I returned mine on October 17th, we are november 21st and I still haven't received my refund.  I have had to call Amazon twice already. I read many comments of people being in the same situation. Customers be aware. Do not buy apple from Amazon.

The quality of the AirPods were very disappointing to say the least. I’m not sure if all the products through this store is refurbished and if so it should be advertised as so I paid for “new” AirPods rather than “used” which is actually a bit cheaper. The quality in sound of these AirPods were very poor, I had to have the volume setting almost at the absolute highest so that they can sound decent. If you lower the volume setting to about half ways it sounds like you have it at its lowest setting. I also realized kg doesn’t offer any of the features real AirPods would offer.

reviewTitle: Love them but not the best fit
reviewDescription: This is my second pair of Airpods. My first pair lasted 7 years.  The fit was better in my old ones, so am not enjoying the fit of these...they do not fit snug and I have to constantly reposition them. Otherwise, they are really nice.So, I have had these since October and they do not fit. They keep falling out! There is no way to fix them or anything I can do about them.Make sure you know what you are buying. Good product. Awful fit!!!!!

I got them and they don’t fit in my ears. I like the AirPods will earpiece on the ends. They never fall out. But beware: get hese only if you know you’re going to keep them. I’ve been trying to return them for three! weeks now. They say UPS has to pick them up and that they have the label with them. I would love to receive a label and take them to UPS myself but they will not supply one. Amazon customer service can’t print the label and tells me to call UPS. UPS says it’s am Amazon issue. I am so unbelievably frustrated

They can’t stay on my ears at all. I wanted them to listen to music while I workout but it’s impossible, they fall off at the slightest movement.I have a very bad habit of throwing the boxes away as soon as I open products, before trying them on. I won’t even be able to return them.

reviewTitle: Volume went down after one month
reviewDescription: Volume went down low after a month. Randomly! I barely used these. Never got them wet. But some how for some reason they barely work. Even when I turn my phone volume all the way up the sound coming from the AirPods is super low. Do not buy. Don’t waste your time or money

reviewTitle: Are you actually meant to wear these in your ears?
reviewDescription: Am rating this with lowest possible stars. Why? The functionality can't be fulfilled if they won't stay put in your ear.When you realize this, you will inevitably Google search a solution. Apple says you should spin the earbuds forward towards your face. This has zero impact. Mostly, I think it's an excuse by Apple toward CYA.My recommendation: buy older versions that have better design towards actually fitting the user's ear.
Todo bien por el momento se ve perfecto estado lo unico que veo un poco mal es que en ocasiones se desconecta solo pero Depues todo bien
Once again I love the quality of the item.

reviewTitle: First time upgarding from Apple AirPods (2nd Generation)
reviewDescription: So I kept delaying upgrading because 2nd Gen worked perfectly for me. So far I have tested 3rd Gen in my phone meetings, walking, and running. The sound quality is definitely better but there are some things that bother me.First, I always had issues keeping the airpod in my right ear. The 2nd gen stayed in OK unless I do some excercise lying flat. 3rd gen is a bit more loose but was still ok running and walking.Second, I really don't like the replacement of tap with click for the controls. Tapping was so easy and convenient. NOw when I run, I have to slow down to find the end of the airpod and carefully click on it, and if I rush there is a good chance I will knock it out of my ear.

The EarPods work great however there is very little instruction on operating the EarPods. I had to search online to find out how charge them and how to increase the volume. Very frustrating!! Not sure why they couldn’t give you that information with the EarPods!
Lasted about 6 mouths till the right ear bud gave out and stopped working properly. First six mouths were great tho!Lol

Perfect sound although no ANC. Much better than the first or second generation AirPods. Good bass for a change. CON: despite looking and fitting like the original AirPods, the 3's always (always!) fall out of my left ear. Uncanny. I hate the in-ear Pros but they're better than the 3's falling out even with idle listening.

Bought this for my wife, because she doesn’t like the silicone on the pros. Good battery life (6 hours) on a single charge and she says they’re very comfortable. She used to wear the Bose QC II headphones all day, but they get uncomfortable after extensive use. The case doesn’t have wireless charging, which was surprising. Also no USB-C charging for the case. If they fixed that and could 8 hours of battery life on a single charge, this would’ve been the perfect product. Overall feels overpriced even at $140, which is $35 off.

reviewTitle: Owners need to clear from their ICloud
reviewDescription: Air Pods look and work great. Only issue is Vincent was the apparent original owner and didn’t disconnect from his ICloud account. Without doing that I can’t register with mine.

I can not seem to find air buds that are right for me. I tried these for a few days and although they sounded great they were uncomfortable and didn’t fit my ear. A good friend recommended them after I returned my Bose so I took a leap. I wish they would have worked.
Good sound as you expect from Apple products.  Easy to use and fits well in your ear. I have heard the beats are good but we are an Apple family and have always been happy.
Case dies not charge wireless
Great sounds, buffers outside noise very well. What I dislike is that when I workout or even go for a walk my right pod falls out, more than 5X now.
My daughter loves, it should be sent with a c port block charger! FYI, order the block charger at same time!!
Fit well, sound great, work as advertised.
Works but not the clearest

reviewTitle: Missing some features but great overall
reviewDescription: These are great overall, it’s got the same great sound quality you’d expect from Apple. It also adds the new spatial audio, which in my opinion is not needed, but it is a cool feature if I am listening to music as it makes it seem as I am there. The shape of the AirPods do not agree with my ear, they might not fall out but after using them for a short period of time I really feel like my ear is sore. It also has indent on the “shaft” of the AirPods and it’s located on both sides. Coming from the Gen 2 air pods, I really miss just the double tap or tap feature of the air pod. You need to grab the indention on the AirPods and from there you need to squeeze that indention to do it. I’d rather have the control system from the Gen 2’s but overall not bad. Would buy again but not without comparing the Gen 2’s first again.
Of course it’s “apple quality” so no problem with that buuut I feel like they be a little too big for the average person ears. They also came dead but that’s fine, battery life is GREAT
the airpods get low after a while

I like the quality of the sound coming out of the headphones. The base is on point and the noise cancellation feature is superb. The pods don’t quite fit my ears. They could easily fall out without knowing. Battery life is average.

I’ve been a big fan. I have AP2, the Pros, and the AirPods 3rd generation. The battery life is so good on the 3rd gen that they’re my go to these days. I really like the shorter stem (vs the AP2) and the battery life blows the Pros out of the water. For me, the AP2 get used for workouts, I use the Pros if I need to be on a call or meeting and I’m somewhere noisy. Otherwise I always reach for the 3rd gen ones. Spatial audio is great, they’re comfortable to wear for long periods, and as previously stated, the battery life is outstanding, just I think they are a little big
Love it

I prefer the feel of the 2nd gen. Took some time to get used to the controls and at first I didn’t like the button style but now I love the button style over the tap. The battery life is not as good as advertised.

Great listening quality but the part that goes in ear is larger that original model and doesn’t fit comfortably. I have to continuously push them back in ear/position. Otherwise, noise canceling works extremely well.

reviewTitle: It is an Apple. You can't say bad thing about it
reviewDescription: We purchased it for my boy birthday, it sounds great and it works as described. We tested against one of the knock off earbub ($30), besides the build, the sound quality is relatively the same.
They slip out my ears when doing movements. The quality is great just the size of the buds.
Me encantaron

reviewTitle: They are perfect except that they don't fit my ears as well as the old airpods
reviewDescription: I have always loved how well the apple earbuds and original apple air pods fit in my ears.  Its almost like they were designed for my ears specifically!  Now I bought these hoping for an even better experience.  They are better in most things...battery life, versatility, etc.  But they changed the shape in such a way that they are more prone to fall out of my ears from time to time.  Not constantly, but just often enough that I knocked off one star.

reviewTitle: Too big to fit in ear and sound great
reviewDescription: Battery life and sound are great, but these are not comfortable sitting in the ear. Definitely engineered poorly for sales and flattery.
Came fast and works fine
They slip out kind of easily at times which is annoying, but the sound quality is nice.
Son de buena calidad y traen un buen sonido 👌... el único problema que tuve fue la entrega de mi producto!! La caja de los audífonos venia mojada, espero que eso no dañe mi producto...
Great sound, excellent bass, you can hear the fullness of whatever you’re listening to, however if you’re active and do a lot of movement these earbuds do NOT start put

reviewTitle: Do not block out noise- I miss my other ear pods
reviewDescription: My noise blocking air pods died on me after 6 years. I bought these. Should have spent the extra money on noise blocking. They work - but not as good.

reviewTitle: The sound is great the fit is painful
reviewDescription: If you like the for of the classic Apple AirPod or headphone these are not for you. They are too wide. They make my ears hurt.
They won't stay in my wife's ears. Apparently only the "pro" version comes with different sizes fittings. That's lame. I would not buy these again.

reviewTitle: They fit different than the 2nd Gen
reviewDescription: I was looking forward to the new ones when my second gen died but these fit differently. I recommend trying in an Apple store first.

reviewTitle: AirPods don't stay in my ears
reviewDescription: I had an older set of AirPods that started to have some charging issues, so I purchased this newer version as a replacement. The main problem is that the actual AirPod pieces don't stay in my ears very well! An AirPod has even fallen out onto the street before unprompted. I almost have to wear them sideways to get them to stay remotely in my ear. I did not have this problem with my older AirPods. Because they don't fit properly in my ears, the sound quality and noise cancellation are not great.

reviewTitle: Nice but don't stay in the ear
reviewDescription: These would get five stars if they didn't keep falling out of my ears. Concept is good, execution leaves a lot to be desired.
The sound is good. Clarity good.I don’t think the battery life is very long. I would look into this and compare products.
Ordered the refurb product and got one that has background static in the right airpod. Had to return.

I ordered these for a Christmas gift, and when it arrived, it was a refurbished set of Airpods (Gen3).  I'm not one to use or give anyone anything you put in your body or (ears) that has been refurbished.  I looked throughout the page and did not see anywhere where it said these items, (sold at new prices) would be refurbished.  So if you're like me and don't want refurb items, you may want to check your packaging when it arrives and if there are non-Apple stickers on it and not the fancy Apple peal away stickers, you may want to send these back.  There needs to be a disclaimer stating whether or not these are refurbished or that you may get a pair of refurbished Airpods.
Battery life is only about 10-12 hrs..sound is terrific but I may send them back because don’t last long. My soundcore liberty earbuds lasted all day and night no problem.

Like how they feel in the ear, sound quality is perfect but… my big two issues is “nothing to block out the background noise and the common thing you probably hear is they keep falling out of my ears”, guess this happens with people who have bigger ear loop. Don’t wanna run the risk of losing them even buying a rubber grip on them not worth it because the case can not close on them. Very disappointed and don’t know why Apple over look this design flaw not everyone has big earlobes.
They are okay for what they are but they are lacking bass and they can get a bit static
Does or did not come with ear pieces to help hold in place. They fall out very easily.

reviewTitle: I like the old generation better
reviewDescription: My hubby bought me these and I gotta say, I like the older generation better.These are too chunky and you can’t tap to skip a song.I’m a big runner and really miss the easy tapping ability.I also feel like I sm charging these more often than my old ones.They also seem to fall out really easy when I barley tou much them.I’ll take my old ones back!

The sound is SO much better than the generation 1 or 2. But the fit is completely different. The AirPod Pros hurt my ears after 30 minutes, the airpod 1 and 2 don’t - they fit so well. The generation 3 fit JUST like the AirPods Pro’s and hurt my ears in the same place (even tho there isn’t the silicone piece). Unfortunately have to return these because of the poor fit.
Quality is great but they’re larger than previous versions and don’t fit in my ears.

The sound is great with these headphones, but there is no way I could wear them except when sitting at my desk since they are way too big for women's ears. When I move around too much, they fall out!  I wish the description would have said something about that - the older ones fit much better. I should have saved my money and just bought the older ones.

reviewTitle: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones,
reviewDescription: So far the fit on these air pods is a problem.  After watching a number of videos it appears that these may not work.  Time will tell. Update.....these will not stay in my ears and the ability to improve hearing for conversations is unacceptable.  The previous 2 generations are much better for hearing conversations and tend to stay in my ears a little better. Not a good purchase for me.

reviewTitle: These don’t fit my ears very well.
reviewDescription: The one for the right ear keeps falling out about every 4-5 minutes. I spend a lot of time outdoors taking care of my pets. For the price, I expected to be able to do all my chores while wearing them. The third time the right one ended up lost in the straw, I decided to go back to over the ear Bluetooth headphones.  Another all hype product from Apple.
nothing wrong just the design is not for my ear, they fit loose i guess will keep using the first generation

reviewTitle: Ya ni me gustan  p q se me caen muy seguidos me arrepentí de comprar
reviewDescription: El producto no me cabe en el oído se me cae muy seguido
Good quality but doesn't fit well like Gen 2I'll be returning it.
I would love it if it stop falling out of ears.

reviewTitle: Amazon piss poor search strikes again!
reviewDescription: its really annoying to be specific on the search request and that not being the first option to buy - all the other crap others want to sell you. I wanted to replace/get a second set of the PRO.  The PRO is only 30$ more which is what I wanted .  For some reason this basic pods don't seem to want to synch with either PC I have, which the pro had no problem doing.; synch fine with ipad and iphone  This will be the last Christmas that I do 100% shopping on Amazon!

Just like the Pros, the Gen 3 AirPods do not stay in my ears. I have used the Gen 2’s at the gym for years with no problems and thought I would upgrade for some of the new features. Unfortunately, just like I experienced with the Pros, the design change makes them fall out of my ears. Had to return.

reviewTitle: Not compatable for individuals with small ears
reviewDescription: I really wanted to upgrade from the 1st gen and I thought they would've been similar in regards to comfort, but I was very wrong. These really hurt my little ears and keep falling out or feel like they're going to fall out. Also, I was very upset that they weren't compatible with MagSafe charging.

reviewTitle: AirPods are too big for my ears, second generation fit so much better
reviewDescription: I bought the third generation after one of my second generation AirPods stopped working. The size difference is very noticeable. These airpods don’t fit my ears. It constantly feels like they’re going to fall out and if I tilt my head during exercise or yoga, they actually do fall out. Super frustrating.

reviewTitle: Sounds great but doesn't fit my wifes ears
reviewDescription: They would have been given a better score but she can't use them 2nd gen would probably been better choice for her as she has smaller ears. They fit me ok but i used different style but I think they sound great. I have no issue. Just wish they were smaller.

Not sure how to rate it, and not sure if it is a flaw with this pair I bought but one ear is definitely not as audible as the other ear.  I looked up how to fix an ear that isn't working, but in the end, it is working, at a much lower decibel than the other and there isn't fix for that.  Can't turn it up to match the other so feels like it isn't working.  Got it on an Amazon flash deal in July, so not sure if this was a new product of a returned product, but it definitely isn't what I would have expected having never had them before.
These are the first Air Pods I have owned. The one in my left ear falls out a good bit. It’s just too large. I hate to return them.  But it looks like I have too.
Very easy to lose but reliable and easy to use. Great battery life and easy to connect to phone. Performs nice but I feel they are a little loose in my ears
didn't like not having a silicone piece to more securely stick inside my ear. Ret'd to buy the Airpods Pro 2 when they were on sale for $189.
These are missing features that the 2nd generation have. The price has also increased within a week since Christmas is near. They were $30 cheaper last week.
The sound was amazingly clear and crisp, however, they would not fit properly in my ears and kept falling out.  Returning for refund.

Sound quality and battery life is great.  However, I am disappointed in two changes they made with this generation.  First, they changed the shape of the part that goes into the ear.  The previous shape was my favorite thing about Airpods...they fit my ear perfectly, never fell out when running, biking, etc.  These fit, but not as tight, and while they haven't fallen out yet, I could see it happening in the future.  The bigger complaint though is they changed how users interact with them.  Instead of tapping them, you now have to press the stem.  This may not seem like a big deal, but I loved the old Airpods where if you were wearing a hat and gloves, you could still tap on them through the fabric to pause/play/answer the phone.  I think Apple would argue that you could use Siri to do this hands free, but I feel Siri gets worse and worse over time.  Even basic commands like "resume podcast" will sometimes trigger no response from Siri and I end up having to take off my gloves and resume on my phone.  Really disappointed in these two changes and will go back to the old version.
The sound is great but the buds are uncomfortable in my ears. The shape is too big for my ear & fits poorly.
My husband said that earbuds kept falling out and he has bigger ears, and they still fell out-so I had to return them.

I’d give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.It is nice, sound quality is great, links to my phone almost immediately- it is also HUGE. It’s made for big ol’ ear holes. I have teeny ear holes so I adjust it and sometimes it pauses the audio when I do. Oops.Overall good, works consistently.Cons are the size and sometimes you have to hold it in front of your phone and open it the case if you want to use it.
